subject: Fashion
title: The Annie Hall Menswear Look
description: A quick win: understand The Annie Hall Menswear Look.

hook.text: Diane Keaton showed up to the Annie Hall set in her own clothes. Woody Allen said keep them.

buildup.text: Oversized vests, wide trousers, men's ties, and floppy hatsâ€”nothing matched, and that was the point.

discovery.text: Costume designer Ruth Morley built the character around Keaton's real wardrobe from thrift stores.

twist.text: Fashion editors were horrified. Then women flooded stores demanding the same look within weeks.

climax.text: Annie Hall proved you didn't need couture to create an iconic style. Personality was the real outfit.

punchline.text: The best costume in film history was her own clothes.

quiz.question: Where did the Annie Hall look actually come from?
options: Diane Keaton's own thrift-store wardrobe was used on set
A Paris couture house created it specifically for the film
Woody Allen sketched each outfit based on 1940s fashion
